sub_title: Associate Professor Health Psychology & Technology at University of Twente
summary:
Christina Bode is psychologist and works as associate professor and director of the Self-management & Health Assessment Lab at the department of Psychology, Health and Technology at the University of Twente.  Her research and teaching is dedicated to the question under which conditions people with chronic illnesses can live a vital and meaningful life and how this aim can be empowered and facilitated with technological innovative measuring and monitoring of patient-reported outcomes and by self-management interventions. She focusses in her research on vitality and fatigue and applies explicit reflective and implicit behavioural change techniques in self-management.
Christina Bode teaches and coordinates (health) psychology education in the Bachelor and Master tracks at the University of Twente and supervises professional and academic post graduate candidates during their research projects. Management responsibilities on department & faculty level and in national associations belong to her professional activities.

publications.name: A mixed-methods process evaluation of a goal management intervention for patients with polyarthritis.

profile_positions.title: Programme Director Bachelor and Master Psychology

profile_positions.description:
Research projects
* Development of a computerized adaptive test for fatigue in patients with rheumatoid arthritis
* Meaning and Measurement of Fatigue in RA 
* Goal-management in arthritis
* Fatigue in patients with Sclerodermia
* Cross-cultural validation of BRAF and RAID

Teaching Mastertrack Health Psychology:
* Health Psychology in lifespan perspective
* Professional Skills for Health Psychologists
* Supervision of Master theses

Teaching Bachelor Psychology
* Social Psychology
* Unconscious processes and health behavior
* Assessment and Health Psychology
* Health Psychology
* Supervision of Bachelor theses

profile_positions.description:
